00001 /* Matthew Hammer <hammer@tti-c.org> */
00002 
00003 /* Code locations are intended for various debugging and profiling
00004    uses.  They are introduced automatically by the SLIME frontend for
00005    interesting uses of the SLIME runtime.  In particular, these
00006    include the following:
00007 
00008    -- closure_call (including "tailcalls")
00009    -- block_alloc
00010    -- modref_write
00011 
00012    For each of these runtime instructions, the current codeloc is
00013    updated by calling codeloc_curr(codeloc) where "codeloc" is
00014    statically unique.
00015 */
00016 #ifndef __SLIME_CODELOC__
00017 #define __SLIME_CODELOC__
00018 
00019 #include <stdio.h>
00020 
00021 typedef struct codeloc_s codeloc_t;
00022 
00023 struct codeloc_s {
00024   const char* file;
00025   const char* func;
00026   int line;
00027   int byte;
00028 };
00029 
00030 #include "closure.h"
00031 #include "block.h"
00032 
00033 codeloc_t* codeloc_curr(codeloc_t* codeloc);
00034 
00035 void codeloc_begin(FILE* f);
00036 void codeloc_end(void);
00037 
00038 void codeloc_fresh_closure(closure_t* closure);
00039 void codeloc_match_closure(closure_t* closure);
00040 void codeloc_enque_closure(closure_t* closure);
00041 void codeloc_awoke_closure(closure_t* closure);
00042 void codeloc_null_closure();
00043 
00044 void codeloc_fresh_block(block_t* block);
00045 void codeloc_match_block(block_t* block);
00046 
00047 #endif
